Context:
Program Name: Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management)
Code: T314
Credential: Honours Bachelor's Degree
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 5 semesters (plus 1 Field Experience semester)
Starting Months: May
Domestic Tuition: $9,418.00 *
International Tuition: $20,925.00 **
Centre: Construction & Engineering Technologies
School: Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Experiential Learning: Mandatory Field Experience
Semester Availability (Domestic): Open (Opens Aug 6, 2024) for Spring 2025
Program Description: Ontario's first internationally accredited four-year degree program specializing in construction management.
Bridging Program Details: For graduates of an Ontario college advanced (three-year) diploma program in Construction Engineering Technology, Civil Engineering Technology, Architecture Technology, Interior Design Technology, or Building Renovation Technology. Students must complete all semester 4 courses successfully before registering for semester 5. Bridging courses are completed as an intensive block during the spring/summer semesters (May to August).

* Domestic tuition may vary depending on specific program requirements and student eligibility for financial assistance or awards.
** International tuition is subject to change based on government policies and exchange rates.

Context:
The text provides information about a completion pathway for graduates of an Ontario college advanced diploma program in Architectural Technology or Interior Design Technology who wish to pursue a degree in Construction Management. Here's the extracted information:

- The students are required to complete Year 3 and Year 4 of the Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) degree program to receive their Bachelor's degree in Construction Management.
- The four-year degree program combines theory, applied research, field study, and hands-on practical education.
- The students will gain knowledge and skills to manage construction projects from start to finish and master construction-related technical disciplines and soft skills.
- The academic credential designation for graduates is Hons. B.Tech (Construction Management).
- The program is recognized by the construction industry and fully accredited by the Canadian Institute of Quantity Surveyors (CIQS).
- Graduates can obtain Gold Seal Certification (GSC) offered by the Canadian Construction Association (CCA).
- The mandatory field experience semester in the third year of the program is a component of the degree program.
- Students are required to complete a minimum of 450 hours of appropriate field experience or the equivalent of verifiable past field experience.
- Students can complete the field experience through the Field Experience course or Prior Learning Assessment Recognition (PLAR) pathways.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) Program (Bridging) T314 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) program at the college prepares students for careers in various roles within the construction industry. These roles include, but are not limited to, construction manager, project manager, project coordinator, field engineer, site superintendent, estimator, project monitor, building science specialist, building condition assessor, construction sales manager, construction claims specialist, construction quality control specialist, construction health and safety specialist, construction cost consultant, developer, project controls specialist, site inspector, contractor, and subcontractor.

Construction managers need specialized skills to succeed in this industry, which is rapidly changing and in high demand for professionals with comprehensive knowledge of construction safety, quality management systems, and sustainable construction practices. The program is fully accredited by the Canadian Institute of Quantity Surveyors (CIQS), the Chartered Institute of Building (CIOB), and the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS). Graduates of the program have completed all academic requirements for professional membership at CIQS and can apply for the Professional Quantity Surveyors (PQS) or Construction Estimator Certified (CEC) designation.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) Program (Bridging) T314 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) degree is offered at George Brown College. Graduates of this program can obtain various certifications in the Canadian construction industry such as Construction Estimator Certification (CEC) and Gold Seal Certification (GSC). The Gold Seal Certification is available for superintendents, forepeople, estimators, project managers, owner’s construction managers, and safety practitioners.

The Gold Seal Certification is highly respected in the construction sector, as stated by industry leaders including Temple Harris, Vice-Chairman of Gillam Group; Christopher Rick, PCL Constructors, Canada Inc.; James Zippel, General Manager of Electrical Service & Projects at Ainsworth; and Greg Kozicz, President of Alberici Constructors, Ltd. These executives believe that the program is important for producing construction professionals with the necessary skills and knowledge to oversee and manage construction projects as the industry continues to expand and become more technology-driven.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) Program (Bridging) T314 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) program graduates are qualified to pursue graduate studies in relevant fields at universities such as Waterloo University, Columbia University, and Toronto Metropolitan University. The required courses for the Construction Management program are spread across four semesters and include subjects like Construction Materials, Construction Estimating, Construction Project Scheduling, Highrise Construction Technology, Construction Site Engineering, and Construction Project Accounting, among others. Students also have to complete a summer field experience of 450 hours as part of their studies. Some other courses offered are Construction Health and Safety, Applications in Building Science, and Construction Contract Administration. The program includes economics courses like Macro and Micro Economics and preconstruction cost planning.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) Program (Bridging) T314 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text provides information about courses offered in a degree completion pathway for Construction Management at George Brown College. Here are the key factual information extracted from the text:

* The program consists of various Building (BLDG) and Management (MGMT) courses, as well as a Liberal Studies Elective.
* Some of the courses include Preconstruction Cost Planning, Applications in Building Information Modeling (BIM), Decision Analysis and Critical Thinking, Research Methods, Construction Project Procurement 1 & 2, Construction Risk Management, Sustainable Construction, Capstone 2 – Industry Research, Project Financial Monitoring, Leadership and Ethics for Construction Managers, and Construction Business Management & Entrepreneurship.
* The program is subject to change.
* Students who graduate with a grade point average of 3.0 or higher from the three-year Architectural Technology (T109) or Interior Design Technology (T170) programs or comparable programs at other Ontario colleges may be eligible to enter this degree completion pathway.
* The program focuses on communication, project analysis, compliance, safety, ethics, sustainability, team development, leadership, human resources management, and business principles and practices in construction projects.
* Contact information for further details: 416-415-5000, ext. 6297 or email construction\_degree@georgebrown.ca.

The Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management recommends that students have a laptop with the following specifications:
- Operating system: Windows 10 Home 64-bit English
- Processor: 9th Generation Intel Core i7-9750H (12MB Cache, up to 4.5 GHz, 6 cores)
- Memory (RAM): 16GB (2x8GB DDR4 2666MHz)
- Disk space: 256GB M.2 PCIe NVMe Solid State Drive (Boot) + 1TB 5400 rpm 2.5" SATA Hard Drive (Storage)
- Display card: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2060 6GB GDDR6
- Internet specifications: 25 to 40 Mbps and a ping time of 20–100 ms

Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
